name: Alakazam
pokemon_power: Damage Swap: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to another as long as you don't Knock Out that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Blastoise
pokemon_power: Rain Dance: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach 1 Water Energy card to 1 of your Water Pokémon. This power can't be used if Blastoise is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.description: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Blastoise but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

variable_damage.note: extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Chansey during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

coin_flip.on_heads: Prevent all damage done to Chansey during opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.description: Chansey does 80 damage to itself.

name: Charizard
pokemon_power: Energy Burn: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may turn all Energy attached to Charizard into Fire Energy for the rest of the turn. This power can't be used if Charizard is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.description: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Charizard in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Metronome
attacks.description: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Metronome copies that attack except for its Energy costs and anything else required to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Rage
attacks.description: Does 50 damage.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Machamp
pokemon_power: Strikes Back: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Machamp (even if it Knocks Out Machamp), this power does 10 damage to the attacking Pokémon. This power can't be used if Machamp is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.description: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. Magneton does 80 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.description: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Barrier
attacks.description: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Mewtwo in order to use this attack. During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Mewtwo.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, it does 30 damage and Nidoking does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.description: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage after each player's turn (instead of 10).

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.description: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.description: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Ninetales in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.description: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Poliwrath but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. Extra Water Energy after the 2nd doesn't count.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.description: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 and discard it.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu during your opponent's next turn.

coin_flip.on_heads: Prevent all damage and effects next turn.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

name: Venusaur
pokemon_power: Energy Trans: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: SolarBeam
attacks.description: Does 60 damage.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.description: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Twineedle
attacks.description: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.description: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.description: Does 70 damage. Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stone Barrage
attacks.description: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderpunch
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, it does 30 damage and Electabuzz does 10 damage to itself.

name: Electrode
pokemon_power: Buzzap: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may Knock Out Electrode and attach it as an Energy card to 1 of your Pokémon. Electrode counts as 2 Lightning Energy cards. This power can't be used if Electrode is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Electric Shock
attacks.description: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrode does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.description: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, they switch 1 of them with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.description: If Pidgeotto was attacked last turn, do the same damage and effects to the opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.description: Does 20 damage.

attacks.description: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Magikarp.

attacks.description: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.description: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.description: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.description: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.description: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half its remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

attacks.description: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 10.

name: Clefairy Doll
effect: Play Clefairy Doll as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Clefairy Doll counts as a Pokémon instead of a Trainer card. Clefairy Doll has no attacks, can’t retreat, and can’t be affected by Special Conditions. If Clefairy Doll is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.

name: Computer Search
effect: Discard 2 other cards from your hand in order to search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Devolution Spray
effect: Choose 1 of your evolved Pokémon in play. Take the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokémon and put it into your hand.

name: Imposter Professor Oak
effect: Your opponent shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck, then draws 7 cards.

name: Item Finder
effect: Discard 2 of the other cards from your hand in order to put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Lass
effect: You and your opponent show each other your hands, then shuffle all Trainer cards from your hands into your decks.

name: Pokémon Breeder
effect: Put a Stage 2 Evolution card from your hand on the matching Basic Pokémon. This counts as evolving that Pokémon.

name: Pokémon Trader
effect: Trade 1 of the Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards in your hand for one in your deck. Show both to your opponent. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Scoop Up
effect: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play and return its Basic Pokémon card to your hand. Discard all cards attached to that card.

name: Super Energy Removal
effect: Discard 1 Energy card attached to one of your Pokémon in order to choose 1 of your opponent’s Pokémon and up to 2 Energy cards attached to it. Discard those Energy cards.

name: Defender
effect: Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokémon. At the end of your opponent's next turn, discard Defender. Damage done to that Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20.

name: Energy Retrieval
effect: Trade 1 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile.

name: Full Heal
effect: Your Active Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

name: Maintenance
effect: Shuffle 2 of the other cards from your hand into your deck in order to draw a card.

name: PlusPower
effect: Attach PlusPower to your Active Pokémon. Discard at the end of your turn. If this Pokémon's attack does damage, that attack does 10 more damage.

name: Pokémon Center
effect: Remove all damage counters from your Pokémon with damage counters on them, then discard all Energy cards attached to those Pokémon.

name: Pokémon Flute
effect: Choose 1 Basic Pokémon card from your opponent’s discard pile and put it onto his or her Bench.

name: Pokédex
effect: Look at up to 5 cards from the top of your deck and rearrange them as you like.

name: Professor Oak
effect: Discard your hand, then draw 7 cards.

name: Revive
effect: Put 1 Basic Pokémon card from your discard pile onto your Bench. Put half the HP of that Pokémon (rounded down to the nearest 10) as damage counters on that Pokémon.

name: Super Potion
effect: Discard 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your own Pokémon in order to remove up to 4 damage counters from that Pokémon.

name: Bill
effect: Draw 2 cards.

name: Energy Removal
effect: Choose 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and discard it.

name: Gust of Wind
effect: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

name: Potion
effect: Remove up to 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Switch
effect: Switch 1 of your Benched Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

name: Double Colorless Energy
effect: Provides two Colorless Energy.

name: Fighting Energy
effect: Provides one Fighting Energy.

name: Fire Energy
effect: Provides one Fire Energy.

name: Grass Energy
effect: Provides one Grass Energy.

name: Lightning Energy
effect: Provides one Lightning Energy.

name: Psychic Energy
effect: Provides one Psychic Energy.

name: Water Energy
effect: Provides one Water Energy.
